page.title: 05FISH FARMING IN BURTON
page.content: There are three{Fish Farms}on the {River Cleddau}where Fish Farmers breed {Salmon}and{Trout. One of the{Fish Farms}is very near the shore,on the south side of the river,on the site where once the "Warrior",the first iron clad war ship was berthed.The other{Fish Farms}are further up river and the Fish Farmers have to go out in boats to get to their stocks. The farms are a series of cages, which are wooden frames covered with netting going down under the water.When the fish grow big enough,they are caught,killed and sold. Even in the roughest weather,the men have to go out to feed the fish with special pellets of meat.
